results.title: The Crab game
results.brief_description: The Crab Game is divided into two parts with each part taking place in different settings. The crab is the main character, a superhero, who can save the world from a dropping water level by recollecting all the water drops before time runs out.

results.title: The County clerk
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper and Central Office of Information for Scottish Home Department
results.brief_description: The manifold duties of a Scottish County Clerk. As the administrative centre has to deal, directly or indirectly, with schools, health, housing, libraries and social services of every kind, and with the civil defence, fire services and police requirements of industry.

results.title: The Cottonseed
results.brief_description: Set in the northern plains of Nigeria the film shows the main stages in the growth of cotton, and gives a glimpse of the cotton ginning process, before ending with an account of the uses of the oilseed crop.

results.title: The Continuous woman
results.brief_description: Entirely the product of collective effort, this film attempts the portrayal of real images of women by looking at five individuals who recognize their strengths and the possibility of alternative roles to those of tradition. Each woman speaks about herself and the portraits merge with one another in a continuous stream of music and photography toward a totality of impression.

results.title: The Conquered desert: Libya
results.brief_description: The Libyan Arab Republic since the revolution of September 1969 has progressed in many ways. There has been a development of an infrastructure of industry and agriculture. There is education for all, cultural centres, housing and health services. In fact, total self-sufficiency has been achieved since the revolution.

results.title: The Common cold
results.creator_credit: Kelly Duncan, Canawest Films and Informedia Productions (US)
results.brief_description: Examines the worth or worthlessness of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamin C and other remedies for the common cold. Emphasises body resistance as the best protection. The structure and function of the virus which causes the cold is explained.

results.title: The Commissar = Kimissar
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “In the town of Berdichev” by Vassily Grossman. In the Ukraine in 1920 during the Russian Civil War, a weary commissar (political officer) finds that she is pregnant. The home of a poor Jewish tinker and his family is requisitioned for her confinement. Mutual suspicion gives way to warmer emotions. The commissar and her new baby become part of his extended family. With flashbacks, a surrealistic dream sequence and grim fantasy, the simple story is given a wider perspective as a meditation on Jewish suffering.

results.title: The Colonial chair
results.brief_description: Two men are each determined to purchase a colonial chair on sale at Sydney’s Salvation Army’s Collection and Waste Products Depot. After a short argument the victor carries off the chair on his motorbike. Filmed on several Saturday mornings, we see bargain hunters assembled outside the gates until 7.30 a.m. opening time. As the gates open there is a rush for the choicest lots in stoves, refrigerators, furniture and bric-a-brac. Photography: Ron Lowe

results.title: The Cologne sports college
results.brief_description: The Sports College in Cologne was founded in 1947. Its aim is to train sports teachers for schools and coaches for sports clubs. The Sports College in Cologne founded in 1947 gives instruction in all branches of sport, theory and practice, to teachers from primary and secondary schools, future physical education industries, youth leaders, local and overseas students. The college has a well-equipped research laboratory to study respiration and circulation during physical exertion and research into muscular fatigue. Coaches include ex-Olympic championing instructing students in athletic, weight training, swimming, gymnastics, javelin throwing.

results.title: The Coconut
results.creator_credit: Douglas Hill, Dudley Birch and Birch Hill Film Productions
results.brief_description: A brief survey of the culture and agriculture of Sri Lanka and study of the cultivation of the coconut as well as the main uses of copra and its by-products.
